Description: Vintage Ray Ban B&L Flying Colors Aviator Changeables Sunglasses with gold and blue/green frame, photochromic grey glass lenses that darken in direct sunlight etched 'BL'. (in these photos the lenses appear light because they were not taken in sunlight - transitions / light-adaptive / variable tint ). Securely dispatched in padded card box postal packaging with original case.Condition: Good vintage condition with some marks on lenses but they do not affect vision. Some of the coloured coating on the frame has worn (see close up photos).Size: At widest point 140mm, lens width 62mm.PayPal only please, items dispatched within 24 hours of payment Shipping to UK 2 days, EU 6 days, US and rest of the world 7 to 10 days with tracking code. No extra shipping charge for extra items (2 items for 1 charge, 3 items 1 charge, etc). Items will be sent to your PayPal delivery address unless I am notified otherwise. Regarding Vintage Ray Bans: - From 1937 to 1998 Ray Bans were made by an optics company called Bausch and Lomb in USA and France, hence the 'BL' engraving on vintage lenses. The 'Ray Ban' logo printed on the lens only appeared on later models from the 80's onwards, earlier examples with no lens logo printed are still genuine - From 1998 to present day Ray Bans have been made by a company called Luxottica in Italy, lenses inscribed with 'RB' By bidding on this auction, UK buyers agree to pay for postage if they choose to return the item. The outgoing post cost is not refunded, only the item value.International returns are not accepted.
